conversationHistory.content: What are some quick stretches I can do at my desk to relieve back pain?

Here are some quick stretches you can do at your desk to help relieve back pain:

1. **Seated Twist**: While sitting, place your right hand on the back of your chair and twist your torso to the right, holding for 15-30 seconds. Repeat on the left side.

2. **Shoulder Rolls**: Sit up straight and roll your shoulders forward in a circular motion, then backward. Do this for 30 seconds.

3. **Neck Stretch**: Gently tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder, and hold for 15-30 seconds on each side.

4. **Cat-Cow Stretch**: While seated, arch your back (like a cat) and then round it (like a cow), moving between these two positions for 15-30 seconds.

5. **Forward Bend**: Stand up, place your feet shoulder-width apart, and bend forward at the hips, letting your arms hang toward the floor. Hold for 15-30 seconds.

6. **Seated Hamstring Stretch**: While sitting, extend one leg straight out and reach for your toes, keeping your back straight. Hold for 15-30 seconds, then switch legs.

Make sure to listen to your body and avoid any movements that cause pain. Regular short breaks and stretches can greatly help in reducing back discomfort. Let me know if you need more tips related to work or health!
